tutorial.title: Welcome to GeoChase

tutorial.step4Content: Create presentations of your treasure hunt solution with animations.

gettingStartedSection.heading: üéØ Welcome to GeoChase
gettingStartedSection.intro: GeoChase is a powerful treasure hunt solver designed to help you discover locations, analyze clues, and find hidden treasures using advanced geographic mapping and location search tools.
gettingStartedSection.whatYouCanDo: Here's what you can do to solve treasure hunts:

features.drawShapes: Draw circles, lines, points, and polygons on an interactive map
features.searchLocations: Search for locations by address and explore nearby places
features.findAlongPaths: Find locations along paths with distance and altitude filters
features.viewElevation: View elevation data for coordinates and search results
features.saveCoordinates: Save coordinates for quick access across projects
features.manageProjects: Create and manage projects with multiple drawings
features.navigate: Navigate around your shapes using arrow keys
features.exportGPX: Export as GPX for use in other mapping applications

accessing.title: Accessing Drawing Tools
accessing.description: All drawing tools are located in the top bar:
accessing.clickButtons: Click the buttons in the center of the top bar to open drawing modals
accessing.collapse: The top bar can be collapsed/expanded using the chevron button
accessing.toolsInclude: Drawing tools include: Circle, Lines (multiple types), Point, and Polygon

circle.title: üîµ Circle
circle.description: Draw a circle on the map by specifying:
circle.name: Name: Give your circle a name (optional, auto-generated if empty)
circle.center: Center Coordinates: Select from your saved coordinates

line.title: ‚ûñ Line
line.description: Draw a line with multiple modes:
line.twoPoints: Two Points: Connect two saved coordinates
line.azimuth: Azimuth Mode: Create a line at a specific angle (azimuth) and distance
line.intersection: Intersection Mode: Draw a line passing through a point at a specific distance
line.parallel: Parallel Mode: Draw a parallel line (latitude) across the map
line.freeHand: Free Hand Mode: Draw lines interactively by clicking on the map with optional azimuth lock
line.dragDrop: Drag & Drop: Drag a point to another point in the layers panel to create a line between them

point.title: üìç Point
point.description: Mark specific locations on the map. Points can be saved as coordinates for reuse.

polygon.title: ‚¨ü Polygon
polygon.description: Create an area by connecting multiple points:
polygon.selectPoints: Select Points: Choose at least 3 existing points from the map
polygon.visual: Visual: Polygons are displayed in light green with semi-transparent fill
polygon.extractCenter: Extract Center: Right-click menu to add the polygon's center as a point and coordinate
polygon.useCase: Use Case: Define search areas, mark zones of interest, or visualize boundaries

addressSearch.title: üèòÔ∏è Address Search
addressSearch.description: Find locations by address and explore nearby places:
addressSearch.step1: Use the search bar in the top bar next to the GeoChase title
addressSearch.step2: Type an address, city, or place name
addressSearch.step3: View results with their coordinates in the dropdown
addressSearch.step4: Click a result to center the map on that location
addressSearch.step5: Create circles or points at the selected location

alongPath.title: üó∫Ô∏è Search Along Path
alongPath.description: Find locations near your drawn lines and points:
alongPath.step1: Draw a line or point on the map
alongPath.step2: Open the Layers panel in the left sidebar
alongPath.step3: Click the ‚ãÆ menu on a line or point
alongPath.step4: Select Search Along from the menu
alongPath.step5: Adjust the search distance with the slider (0.5 - 25 km)
alongPath.step6: Filter results by altitude range for elevation analysis
alongPath.step7: Filter by name to find specific locations
alongPath.step8: Click results to mark them on the map

tips.title: üí° Tips
tips.elevationData: Search results include automatic elevation data
tips.altitudeFilter: Use altitude filtering to find locations at specific elevations
tips.filtered: Results are filtered by location type (place, amenity, etc.)
tips.nameFilter: Click the name filter field to search across all results

navigationSection.heading: üß≠ Navigate Around Shapes
navigationSection.intro: Use arrow keys to move around circles and lines:

howTo.title: How to Navigate
howTo.step2: Click the ‚ãÆ (menu) button on a circle or line

tips.title: üí° Tips
tips.speedAdjust: Speed adjusts automatically based on zoom level
tips.zoomBehavior: Higher zoom = smaller movements, lower zoom = larger movements
tips.sidebarHide: The sidebar hides during navigation for a clearer view

layersSection.heading: üìö Layers Panel
layersSection.intro: Manage all your drawings in the left sidebar:

accessing.title: Accessing the Layers Panel
accessing.location: The layers panel is located in the left sidebar
accessing.toggle: Toggle the left sidebar using the button on the left edge of the screen
accessing.sections: All circles, lines, points, and polygons are listed in separate sections

actions.title: Layer Actions
actions.click: Click item: Navigate to and center on the shape
actions.menu: Click ‚ãÆ menu: Show options for the shape
actions.hideShow: üëÅ Hide/Show: Toggle visibility on the map
actions.searchAlong: üîç Search Along: Find locations near the element (lines and points)
actions.navigate: üß≠ Navigate: Use arrow keys to move around the shape (circles and lines)
actions.bearings: üß≠ Bearings: View distances and azimuths to all other points (points only)
actions.createWith: ‚ûï Create with: Create new shapes from a point
actions.addCenter: ‚¨ü Add center as point: Extract polygon center as a point and coordinate (polygons only)

dragDrop.title: Drag & Drop
dragDrop.drag: Drag a point from the Points section to another point
dragDrop.autoCreate: A line will automatically be created connecting the two points
dragDrop.naming: The line is named "Point A ‚Üí Point B" with distance and azimuth info
dragDrop.fastest: This is the fastest way to connect existing points

notesSection.heading: üìù Notes
notesSection.intro: Add notes to your drawings to document important information, observations, or clues:

howToAdd.title: How to Add Notes
howToAdd.step1: Open the Layers panel in the left sidebar
howToAdd.step2: Click the ‚ãÆ menu on a circle, line, point, or polygon
howToAdd.step3: Select Add note from the menu
howToAdd.step4: Enter a title and content for your note
howToAdd.step5: Click Save to attach the note to the element

managing.title: Managing Notes
managing.viewOnMap: View notes on map: Notes appear as tooltips when you hover over elements on the map
managing.edit: Edit notes: Click the ‚ãÆ menu and select "Edit note" to modify an existing note
managing.delete: Delete notes: Click the trash icon in the note tooltip or edit the note and delete it
managing.onePerElement: One note per element: Each element can have only one note
managing.saved: Notes are saved: Notes are stored with your project and included in exports

useCases.title: üí° Use Cases
useCases.clues: Document clues or hints associated with specific locations
useCases.observations: Record observations about terrain, landmarks, or features
useCases.whyCreated: Keep track of why you created a particular circle or line
useCases.calculations: Store calculations, measurements, or reference data
useCases.reminders: Add reminders or next steps for your treasure hunt investigation

coordinatesSection.heading: üìå Saved Coordinates
coordinatesSection.intro: Save frequently-used locations for quick access:

howToSave.title: How to Save Coordinates
howToSave.step1: Right-click on the map to save a location
howToSave.step2: A modal will open with the coordinates pre-filled
howToSave.step3: Enter a name for the coordinate (or leave empty for auto-generated address)
howToSave.step4: Click Save to add it to your coordinates library
howToSave.step5: Click Save & Point to save and create a point on the map

managing.title: Managing Coordinates
managing.access: Access the coordinates modal from the top bar (book icon)
managing.view: View all saved coordinates with their lat/lon values
managing.edit: Edit existing coordinates by clicking the pencil icon
managing.delete: Delete coordinates by clicking the trash icon
managing.sorted: Coordinates are sorted by creation date (newest first)

useCases.title: üí° Use Cases
useCases.saveFirst: Save locations before drawing - all shapes require saved coordinates
useCases.library: Build a library of important locations for your treasure hunt
useCases.quickReference: Quick reference points for multiple projects
useCases.reuse: Reuse coordinates across different drawings without re-entering them
useCases.autoGenerated: Auto-generated names use reverse geocoding to find addresses

projectsSection.heading: üóÇÔ∏è Projects
projectsSection.intro: Organize your work into separate projects:

accessing.title: Accessing Project Management
accessing.icon: Click the save icon in the top bar to access project options
accessing.dropdown: A dropdown menu shows all project actions

projectActions.title: Project Actions
projectActions.newProject: New Project: Create a new empty project
projectActions.loadProject: Load Project: Switch to another saved project from the modal
projectActions.exportJSON: Export JSON: Save your project as a JSON file for backup
projectActions.importJSON: Import JSON: Load a project from a JSON file
projectActions.exportGPX: Export GPX: Export your drawings as GPX for use in other apps (download icon in top bar)

features.title: Features
features.storage: Each project stores all your drawings and coordinates separately
features.autoSave: Projects are saved automatically to your browser's local storage
features.renameDelete: Rename or delete projects from the Load Project modal
features.gpxExport: Export as GPX to use your drawings in other mapping applications

pdfSection.heading: üìÑ PDF Documents
pdfSection.intro: Attach PDF documents to your projects for reference while working on the map:

uploading.title: Uploading a PDF
uploading.step1: Click the PDF icon in the top bar (next to the tutorial button)
uploading.step2: If no PDF is attached, a file picker will open
uploading.step4: The PDF will be stored with your project

viewing.title: Viewing PDFs
viewing.openPanel: Click the PDF icon when a PDF is attached to open the viewer panel
viewing.resize: Drag the left edge of the panel to resize it
viewing.navigate: Use the page navigation controls to browse through pages
viewing.zoom: Use zoom controls or pinch to zoom in/out on the document

passwordProtected.title: Password-Protected PDFs
passwordProtected.step2: The password is saved so you don't need to re-enter it on reload
passwordProtected.step3: The password is stored locally and never sent to any server

features.title: Features
features.storage: PDFs are stored in your browser's IndexedDB (separate from project data)
features.perProject: Each project can have its own PDF document
features.delete: Delete a PDF by clicking the trash icon in the panel header
features.notExported: Note: PDFs are NOT included in JSON exports (to keep file sizes manageable)

keyboardShortcuts.title: ‚å®Ô∏è Keyboard Shortcuts
keyboardShortcuts.arrows: Arrow Keys (‚Üê ‚Üí) - Navigate along circles/lines during navigation mode
keyboardShortcuts.z: Z - Toggle precision mode (magnified lens view)
keyboardShortcuts.esc: ESC - Exit navigation mode, precision mode, or cancel free hand drawing
keyboardShortcuts.rightClick: Right-click on map - Save coordinates at that location (also closes precision mode)
keyboardShortcuts.alt: ALT - Hold during free hand drawing to lock azimuth (only when no predefined azimuth)
keyboardShortcuts.ctrl: CTRL - Hold during free hand drawing to lock distance

precisionMode.title: üîç Precision Mode
precisionMode.description: Precision mode provides a magnified view of the map for accurate positioning:
precisionMode.activate: Activate: Press the Z key to toggle precision mode
precisionMode.lens: Magnified lens: A circular lens appears above your cursor showing a 2.5x magnified view
precisionMode.crosshair: Crosshair: The center crosshair helps you pinpoint exact locations
precisionMode.sameZoom: Same zoom level: The lens shows the same map zoom level, just magnified for easier viewing
precisionMode.deactivate: Deactivate: Press Z again, ESC, or right-click to exit
precisionMode.use: Use precision mode when placing points, drawing lines, or examining detailed map features

bearingsAnalysis.title: üß≠ Bearings Analysis
bearingsAnalysis.description: Analyze distances and directions between points for treasure hunt navigation:
bearingsAnalysis.openView: Open bearings view - Click ‚ãÆ menu on any point and select "Bearings"
bearingsAnalysis.viewCalc: View calculations - See distance (km), azimuth (bearing to point), and inverse azimuth (return bearing) for all other points
bearingsAnalysis.sort: Sort data - Click column headers to sort by any field
bearingsAnalysis.navigate: Navigate quickly - Click any row to close the modal and jump to that point on the map
bearingsAnalysis.use: Use bearings to triangulate locations or verify geometric relationships between points

drawingTips.title: üéØ Drawing Tips
drawingTips.saveFirst: Save coordinates first - Right-click on the map to save locations before drawing shapes
drawingTips.quickLine: Quick line creation - Drag a point to another point in the layers panel to instantly create a line

freeHandMode.title: Free Hand Mode - Draw lines interactively by clicking start and end points:
freeHandMode.setStart: Click on the map to set the start point
freeHandMode.preview: Move your mouse to preview the line with real-time distance and azimuth
freeHandMode.lockAzimuth: Hold ALT to lock the azimuth (direction) at the current angle - useful for drawing parallel lines or maintaining specific directions
freeHandMode.lockDistance: Hold CTRL to lock the distance at the current length - useful for drawing multiple lines of the same length
freeHandMode.tooltip: The floating tooltip shows whether azimuth or distance is locked
freeHandMode.finalize: Click again to finalize the line
freeHandMode.predefined: When using predefined azimuth lock from the modal, ALT keybind is disabled

drawingTips.multipleLines: Create multiple line to map routes or paths
drawingTips.intersectionMode: Use intersection mode to draw lines passing through specific points
drawingTips.azimuthMode: Use azimuth mode with precise angles (supports 2 decimal places, e.g., 45.67¬∞) for exact positioning
drawingTips.parallelMode: Parallel mode draws latitude lines across the entire map
drawingTips.autoNames: Names are auto-generated based on locations if left empty

searchWorkflow.searchAlong: Use "Search Along Path" to find nearby locations
searchWorkflow.filterAltitude: Filter by altitude if you're looking for specific terrain elevation
searchWorkflow.markFindings: Mark interesting findings as new circles or points
